metadata.name: Web/Function App Deployment Slots
metadata.description: This module deploys a Web or Function App Deployment Slot.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Optional. The service (sub-) type to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "vault" or "blob".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if privateDnsZoneResourceIds were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint with. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.
Required. A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private ip address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllLogs' to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Name of the slot.
Conditional. The name of the parent site resource. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Required. Type of slot to deploy.
Optional. The resource ID of the app service plan to use for the slot.
Optional. Configures a slot to accept only HTTPS requests. Issues redirect for HTTP requests.
Optional. If client affinity is enabled.
Optional. The resource ID of the app service environment to use for this resource.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. The resource ID of the assigned identity to be used to access a key vault with.
Optional. Checks if Customer provided storage account is required.

Optional. Azure Resource Manager ID of the Virtual network and subnet to be joined by Regional VNET Integration. This must be of the form /subscriptions/{subscriptionName}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{vnetName}/subnets/{subnetName}.
Optional. The site config object.
Optional. Required if app of kind functionapp. Resource ID of the storage account to manage triggers and logging function executions.
Optional. Resource ID of the app insight to leverage for this resource.
Optional. For function apps. If true the app settings "AzureWebJobsDashboard" will be set. If false not. In case you use Application Insights it can make sense to not set it for performance reasons.
Optional. The app settings-value pairs except for AzureWebJobsStorage, AzureWebJobsDashboard, APPINSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATIONKEY and APPLICATIONINSIGHTS_CONNECTION_STRING.
Optional. The auth settings V2 configuration.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. To enable client certificate authentication (TLS mutual authentication).
Optional. Client certificate authentication comma-separated exclusion paths.

Optional. This composes with ClientCertEnabled setting.

- ClientCertEnabled: false means ClientCert is ignored.

- ClientCertEnabled: true and ClientCertMode: Required means ClientCert is required.

- ClientCertEnabled: true and ClientCertMode: Optional means ClientCert is optional or accepted.
Optional. If specified during app creation, the app is cloned from a source app.
Optional. Size of the function container.
Optional. Unique identifier that verifies the custom domains assigned to the app. Customer will add this ID to a txt record for verification.
Optional. Maximum allowed daily memory-time quota (applicable on dynamic apps only).
Optional. Setting this value to false disables the app (takes the app offline).
Optional. Hostname SSL states are used to manage the SSL bindings for app's hostnames.
Optional. Hyper-V sandbox.
Optional. Allow or block all public traffic.
Optional. Site redundancy mode.
Optional. The site publishing credential policy names which are associated with the site slot.
Optional. To enable accessing content over virtual network.
Optional. To enable pulling image over Virtual Network.
Optional. Virtual Network Route All enabled. This causes all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied.
Optional. Names of hybrid connection relays to connect app with.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Site Slot App Settings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Site Slot App Setting.
Required. Slot name to be configured.
Conditional. The name of the parent site resource. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Type of slot to deploy.
Optional. Required if app of kind functionapp. Resource ID of the storage account to manage triggers and logging function executions.
Optional. Resource ID of the app insight to leverage for this resource.
Optional. For function apps. If true the app settings "AzureWebJobsDashboard" will be set. If false not. In case you use Application Insights it can make sense to not set it for performance reasons.
Optional. The app settings key-value pairs except for AzureWebJobsStorage, AzureWebJobsDashboard, APPINSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATIONKEY and APPLICATIONINSIGHTS_CONNECTION_STRING.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

resources.name: [format('{0}/{1}/{2}', parameters('appName'), parameters('slotName'), 'appsettings')]
resources.properties: [union(parameters('appSettingsKeyValuePairs'), if(not(empty(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'))), union(createObject('AzureWebJobsStorage', format('DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName={0};AccountKey={1};', last(split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')), listKeys(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', last(split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/'))), '2023-01-01').keys[0].value)), if(equals(parameters('setAzureWebJobsDashboard'), true()), createObject('AzureWebJobsDashboard', format('DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName={0};AccountKey={1};', last(split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')), listKeys(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', last(split(parameters('storageAccountResourceId'), '/'))), '2023-01-01').keys[0].value)), createObject())), createObject()), if(not(empty(parameters('appInsightResourceId'))), createObject('APPINSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATIONKEY', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.Insights/components', last(split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/'))), '2020-02-02').InstrumentationKey, 'APPLICATIONINSIGHTS_CONNECTION_STRING', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.Insights/components', last(split(parameters('appInsightResourceId'), '/'))), '2020-02-02').ConnectionString), createObject()))]

metadata.description: The name of the slot config.
The resource ID of the slot config.
The resource group the slot config was deployed into.

metadata.name: Site Slot Auth Settings V2 Config
metadata.description: This module deploys a Site Auth Settings V2 Configuration.
Conditional. The name of the parent site resource. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Slot name to be configured.
Required. Type of slot to deploy.
Required. The auth settings V2 configuration.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the slot config.
The resource ID of the slot config.
The resource group the slot config was deployed into.

metadata.name: Web Site Slot Basic Publishing Credentials Policies
metadata.description: This module deploys a Web Site Slot Basic Publishing Credentials Policy.
Required. The name of the resource.
Optional. Set to true to enable or false to disable a publishing method.
Conditional. The name of the parent web site. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent web site slot. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the basic publishing credential policy.
The resource ID of the basic publishing credential policy.
The name of the resource group the basic publishing credential policy was deployed into.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Web/Function Apps Slot Hybrid Connection Relay
metadata.description: This module deploys a Site Slot Hybrid Connection Namespace Relay.
Required. The resource ID of the relay namespace hybrid connection.
Conditional. The name of the site slot. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent web site. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Name of the authorization rule send key to use.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the hybrid connection relay..
The resource ID of the hybrid connection relay.

resourceId.value: [resourceId('Microsoft.Web/sites/slots/hybridConnectionNamespaces/relays', split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('appName'), parameters('slotName'), split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[8], split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[10]), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('appName'), parameters('slotName'), split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[8], split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[10]), '/')[1], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('appName'), parameters('slotName'), split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[8], split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[10]), '/')[2], split(format('{0}/{1}/{2}/{3}', parameters('appName'), parameters('slotName'), split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[8], split(parameters('hybridConnectionResourceId'), '/')[10]), '/')[3])]

metadata.description: The name of the resource group the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private ip address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.
Required. A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if `privateDnsZoneResourceIds` were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.

The location the resource was deployed into.
